description: Metrics useful for benchmarking and loadtesting Prometheus itself. Designed primarily for Prometheus 2.x.x

panels.description: This chart displays maximum quantile duration for each query slice. It's just informative for more exact profiling use histograms for each type of slice.
panels.title: Query elapsed time per slice

panels.description: This graph displays number of time series ingested (+) in the head block and also count of deleted series (-).
panels.title: Head series created/deleted

panels.description:
This graph shows most of errors exposed by the Prometheus. Not all of them are critical but better watch this for some unusual behavior. 
Those are:
   - scrapes_exceeded_sample_limit
   - scrapes_sample_duplicate_timestamp
   - scrapes_sample_out_of_bounds
   - scrapes_sample_out_of_order
   - rule_evaluation_failures
   - tsdb_compactions_failed
   - tsdb_reloads_failures
   - tsdb_head_series_not_found
   - evaluator_iterations_missed
   - evaluator_iterations_skipped
panels.title: Prometheus errors

panels.description:
This graph displays scrape delay based on time between last scrapes minus scrape interval.
It's the highest quantile value.
panels.title: Scrape delay

panels.description: How long for given percentage of evaluated rules did it take
panels.title: Rule evaulation duration

panels.description: Graph showing actual count of HTTP requests called on given endpoints of Prometheus
panels.title: Request count per handler

panels.description: Max request duration of HTTP requests per handlers. It displays biggest quantile for each handler. For more exact data use histogram per handler.
panels.title: Max request duration per handler

panels.description: Max request size of HTTP requests per handler. It displays biggest quantile for each handler. For more exact data use histogram per handler.
panels.title: Max request size by handler

panels.description: Graph shows actual count of concurrent queries and limit value as yellow line set in Prometheus configuration.
panels.title: Count of concurrent queries

panels.description: Graph shows actual count of alert notifications  and limit of queue size  as yellow line set in Prometheus configuration.
panels.title: Alert notifications queue size

panels.description: Graph shows actual count of alertmanagers Prometheus discovered using alertmanager SD.
panels.title: Count of discovered alertmanagers

panels.description:
Graph displaying errors in alerting by type.
Types are:
   - notifications_dropped
   - rule_evaluation_failures
panels.title: Alerting errors

panels.content:
Service discovery row is customized to show info about SD I use in my setup (Consul, Marathon, Kubernetes). Does'n seem to be generic for all SD types so it's hard to make it general.

I leave it here collapsed as an inspiration but you will probably want to **customize this**. Also the The **errors graph shows also just those three SD specific errors**.
panels.title: Service discovery row

panels.description: Count of requests for Sonsul SD specified by `scrape_job` label
panels.title: Consul SD sync count

panels.description: Count of requests for Marathon SD specified by `scrape_job` label
panels.title: Marathon SD sync count

panels.description: Count of requests for Kuernetes SD specified by `scrape_job` label
panels.title: Kubernetes SD sync count

panels.description:
Graph displaying errors related to SD.
Again not all of them has to be critical but better watch out for them.
Types are:
   - sd_file_read_errors
   - sd_consul_rpc_failures
   - sd_marathon_refresh_failures
   - sd_openstack_refresh_failures
panels.title: Service discovery errors

panels.description: Shows total count of time series in head block of TSDB.
panels.title: Time series total count in head

panels.description: Count of appended samples to head block of TSDB per second
panels.title: Samples Appended per second

panels.content:
Two rows bellow can serve as example if you are running **Prometheus** in **Kubernetes** and uses **Heapster** with **InfluxDB**.

The schema and queries are very hard to generalize so you will have to tweak them but I leave them here for inspiration.
panels.title: Heapster rows

targets.query: SELECT mean("value")/1000 as "usage_rate.mean"  FROM "cpu/usage_rate" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "container_name" =~ /prometheus/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY container_name, time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("value")/1000 as "usage_rate.mean"  FROM "cpu/usage_rate" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "container_name" =~ /prometheus/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY container_name, time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value")/1000 as "CPU LIMIT"  FROM "cpu/limit" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "container_name" =~ /prometheus/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY container_name, time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") as "usage_rate.mean"  FROM "memory/usage" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "container_name" =~ /prometheus/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY container_name, time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("value") as "usage_rate.mean"  FROM "memory/usage" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "container_name" =~ /prometheus/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY container_name, time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "CPU LIMIT"  FROM "memory/limit" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "container_name" =~ /prometheus/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY container_name, time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "rx_rate.mean "  FROM "network/rx_rate"  WHERE  "labels" =~ /app:prometheus/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY labels,  time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "rx_rate.mean"  FROM "network/rx_rate"  WHERE  "labels" =~ /app:prometheus/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY  labels,  time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value")*-1 as "tx_rate.mean "  FROM "network/tx_rate"  WHERE  "labels" =~ /app:prometheus/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY labels,  time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value")*-1 as "tx_rate.mean"  FROM "network/tx_rate"  WHERE  "labels" =~ /app:prometheus/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY  labels, time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "rx_errors_rate.mean"  FROM "network/rx_errors_rate"  WHERE  "labels" =~ /app:prometheus/ AND $timeFilter AND "value">0 GROUP BY  labels,  time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "rx_errors_rate.mean"  FROM "network/rx_errors_rate"  WHERE  "labels" =~ /app:prometheus/ AND $timeFilter AND "value">0 GROUP BY  labels,  time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "tx_errors_rate.mean"  FROM "network/rx_errors_rate"  WHERE  "labels" =~ /app:prometheus/ AND $timeFilter AND "value">0 GROUP BY  labels,  time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "tx_errors_rate.mean"  FROM "network/rx_errors_rate"  WHERE  "labels" =~ /app:prometheus/ AND $timeFilter AND "value">0 GROUP BY  labels,  time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "DISK_USAGE.mean "  FROM "filesystem/usage" WHERE  "labels" =~ /data-prometheus:true/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY  time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "DISK_USAGE.mean "  FROM "filesystem/usage" WHERE  "labels" =~ /data-prometheus:true/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY  time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "DISK_LIMIT.mean "  FROM "filesystem/limit" WHERE  "labels" =~ /data-prometheus:true/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY  time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "DISK_LIMIT.mean"  FROM "filesystem/limit" WHERE  "labels" =~ /data-prometheus:true/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "FREE_INODES.mean "  FROM "filesystem/inodes_free" WHERE  "labels" =~ /data-prometheus:true/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "FREE_INODES.mean"  FROM "filesystem/inodes_free" WHERE  "labels" =~ /data-prometheus:true/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "USED_INODES.mean "  FROM "filesystem/inodes" WHERE  "labels" =~ /data-prometheus:true/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("value") as "USED_INODES.mean"  FROM "filesystem/inodes" WHERE  "labels" =~ /data-prometheus:true/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

title: Prometheus2.0 (v1.0.0 by FUSAKLA)
